intro: Jurinea stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sea bladder, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is native to coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and inconspicuous flowers, which are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and saline environments. Jurinea stenophylla plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for various small invertebrates.
